alert.note: Alert for Harding (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 8:14PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Harding, northeastern Butte, northern Meade and western Perkins Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 814 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Buffalo to 3 miles south of Sorum to 3 miles southeast of Mud Butte. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sorum around 820 PM MDT. Prairie City around 830 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Ludlow, Lodgepole and Date. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northwestern South Dakota.
